verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Go unto Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what LORD says, “Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Go to Pharaoh and tell him, 'This is what the LORD says: Let my people go so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
verses.web: If you refuse to let them go, behold, I will plague all your borders with frogs.
verses.ct: If you refuse to let them go, I will strike your entire country with a plague of frogs.

verses.kjv: And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneadingtroughs:
verses.web: The river will swarm with frogs, which will go up and come into your house, and into your bedroom, and on your bed, and into the house of your servants, and on your people, and into your ovens, and into your kneading troughs.
verses.ct: The Nile will swarm with frogs. They'll crawl into your palace, into your bedroom, and onto your bed. They'll invade your servants' houses, crawl all over your people, and get into your ovens and your bread dough.

verses.kjv: And the frogs shall come up both on thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
verses.web: The frogs shall come up both on you, and on your people, and on all your servants.” ’ ”
verses.ct: The frogs will swarm over you, your people, and every one of your servants."'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thine hand with thy rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Stretch out your hand with your rod over the rivers, over the streams, and over the pools, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Tell Aaron to stretch out his hand with his staff over the rivers, streams, and pools, and bring frogs up across the whole land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.web: Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: So Aaron stretched his hand out over the waters of Egypt, and frogs came up and covered the entire land.

verses.kjv: And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
verses.web: The magicians did the same thing with their enchantments, and brought up frogs on the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: But the magicians did the same thing with their sorcery, bringing even more frogs onto the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Intreat the LORD, that he may take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may do sacrifice unto the LORD.
verses.web: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Entreat LORD, that he take away the frogs from me and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice to LORD.”
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, "Pray to the LORD to take these frogs away from me and my people, and I'll let your people go to offer sacrifices to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Glory over me: when shall I intreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee and thy houses, that they may remain in the river only?
verses.web: Moses said to Pharaoh, “I give you the honor of setting the time that I should pray for you, and for your servants, and for your people, that the frogs be destroyed from you and your houses, and remain in the river only.”
verses.ct: Moses replied, "I'll give you the honor of choosing the time. When should I pray for you, your servants, and your people so that the frogs are destroyed everywhere except in the Nile?"

verses.kjv: And he said, To morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word: that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the LORD our God.
verses.web: Pharaoh said, “Tomorrow.” Moses said, “Let it be according to your word, that you may know that there is no one like LORD our God.
verses.ct: "Tomorrow," Pharaoh said. Moses answered, "It will be just as you say, so that you'll know there is no one like the LORD our God.

verses.kjv: And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
verses.web: The frogs shall depart from you, and from your houses, and from your servants, and from your people. They shall remain in the river only.”
verses.ct: The frogs will leave you, your houses, your servants, and your people. They'll remain only in the Nile."

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto the LORD because of the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
verses.web: Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh, and Moses cried to LORD concerning the frogs which he had brought on Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron left Pharaoh, and Moses cried out to the LORD about the frogs he had brought against Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.
verses.web: LORD did according to the word of Moses, and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields.
verses.ct: The LORD did exactly what Moses asked. The frogs died — in the houses, in the courtyards, and in the fields.

verses.kjv: And they gathered them together upon heaps: and the land stank.
verses.web: They gathered them together in heaps, and the land stank.
verses.ct: The people piled them up in huge heaps, and the whole land reeked.

verses.kjv: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.web: But when Pharaoh saw that there was a respite, he hardened his heart, and didn’t listen to them, as LORD had spoken.
verses.ct: But as soon as Pharaoh saw that the crisis was over, he hardened his heart and refused to listen to Moses and Aaron, just as the LORD had predicted.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the land, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Stretch out your rod, and strike the dust of the earth, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Tell Aaron to stretch out his staff and strike the dust on the ground, so that it becomes lice throughout all of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And they did so; for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and it became lice in man, and in beast; all the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.web: They did so; and Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and struck the dust of the earth, and there were lice on man, and on animal; all the dust of the earth became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: They did it. Aaron stretched out his hand with his staff and struck the dust of the ground. Lice swarmed over every person and animal — all the dust across Egypt turned into lice.

verses.kjv: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man, and upon beast.
verses.web: The magicians tried with their enchantments to produce lice, but they couldn’t. There were lice on man, and on animal.
verses.ct: The magicians tried to produce lice with their sorcery, but this time they couldn't do it. The lice covered people and animals alike.

verses.kjv: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had said.
verses.web: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, “This is God’s finger;” but Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he didn’t listen to them, as LORD had spoken.
verses.ct: The magicians told Pharaoh, "This is the finger of God." But Pharaoh's heart remained hard, and he refused to listen, just as the LORD had said.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; behold, he comes out to the water; and tell him, ‘This is what LORD says, “Let my people go, that they may serve me.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Get up early in the morning and confront Pharaoh as he goes down to the water. Tell him, 'This is what the LORD says: Let my people go so they can worship me.

verses.kjv: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
verses.web: Else, if you will not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you, and on your servants, and on your people, and into your houses. The houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground they are on.
verses.ct: If you won't let my people go, I will send massive swarms of flies on you, your servants, your people, and your houses. Every Egyptian home will be filled with flies, and so will the ground beneath their feet.

verses.kjv: And I will sever in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
verses.web: I will set apart in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there, to the end you may know that I am LORD on the earth.
verses.ct: But on that day I will treat the land of Goshen differently — where my people live. No flies will be found there. This way you'll know that I, the LORD, am at work right here on this earth.

verses.kjv: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to morrow shall this sign be.
verses.web: I will put a division between my people and your people. This sign shall happen by tomorrow.” ’ ”
verses.ct: I will make a clear distinction between my people and your people. This sign will happen tomorrow."'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD did so; and there came a grievous swarm of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses, and into all the land of Egypt: the land was corrupted by reason of the swarm of flies.
verses.web: LORD did so; and there came grievous swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses. In all the land of Egypt the land was corrupted by reason of the swarms of flies.
verses.ct: The LORD did exactly that. Terrible swarms of flies poured into Pharaoh's palace, into his servants' houses, and across all of Egypt. The flies devastated the land.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
verses.web: Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, “Go, sacrifice to your God in the land!”
verses.ct: Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, "Fine — go sacrifice to your God, but do it here in this land."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God: lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
verses.web: Moses said, “It isn’t appropriate to do so; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to LORD our God. Behold, if we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, won’t they stone us?
verses.ct: Moses replied, "That won't work. The sacrifices we offer to the LORD our God would be deeply offensive to the Egyptians. If we slaughter animals they consider sacred right in front of them, they'll stone us to death.

verses.kjv: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God, as he shall command us.
verses.web: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to LORD our God, as he shall command us.”
verses.ct: We need to travel 3 days' journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God, just as he commands us."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: intreat for me.
verses.web: Pharaoh said, “I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to LORD your God in the wilderness, only you shall not go very far away. Pray for me.”
verses.ct: Pharaoh said, "All right, I'll let you go sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness — just don't go too far. And pray for me."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will intreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to morrow: but let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.
verses.web: Moses said, “Behold, I am going out from you. I will pray to LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, tomorrow; only don’t let Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to LORD.”
verses.ct: Moses said, "As soon as I leave you, I'll pray to the LORD, and tomorrow the swarms of flies will leave you, your servants, and your people. But Pharaoh must not deceive us again by refusing to let the people go to sacrifice to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and intreated the LORD.
verses.web: Moses went out from Pharaoh, and prayed to LORD.
verses.ct: Moses left Pharaoh and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
verses.web: LORD did according to the word of Moses, and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. There remained not one.
verses.ct: The LORD did what Moses asked. He removed every last fly from Pharaoh, his servants, and his people — not a single one remained.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, neither would he let the people go.
verses.web: Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also, and he didn’t let the people go.
verses.ct: But once again, Pharaoh hardened his heart and refused to let the people go.
